# This File Tests Paragraphs and Lists

This is a paragraph that demonstrates plain text content in markdown. Paragraphs are separated by blank lines and can contain multiple sentences like this one.

Here is another paragraph to show paragraph separation. This paragraph exists to verify that the parser correctly handles multiple paragraphs in sequence.

## This Section Contains Various List Types

This file contains the following list structures for testing:

- This is an unordered list item
- This is another unordered list item
- This item has a nested list:
  - Nested item one
  - Nested item two
  - Even deeper nesting:
    - Third level item
    - Another third level item

## This Section Has Ordered Lists

1. First ordered item
2. Second ordered item
3. Third ordered item with nested content:
   - Mixed list: unordered inside ordered
   - Another mixed item
4. Fourth ordered item

## This Section Combines Everything

This paragraph introduces a complex list structure below:

- Unordered item with text
  1. Nested ordered list
  2. Second ordered item
  - Back to unordered
- Another unordered item
  - [ ] Unchecked task item
  - [x] Checked task item
  - [ ] Another unchecked task
